Package Manager

Class TableMgr

java.lang.Object
Manager.TableMgr
public class TableMgr extends Object
Represents the class which manages anything related to the tables in the restaurant.
Since:
2021-11-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jovian Nursan Ng

  • Method Details

    • readTables

      public static void readTables​(ArrayList<Table> tables) throws FileNotFoundException
      Reads the file Table.txt and inputs the data in the text file into the ArrayList tables.
      Parameters:
      tables - The array list containing all the tables and their attributes in the restaurant.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException

    • addRestTables

      public static void addRestTables​(int num)
      Adds Tables into the array list tables.
      Parameters:
      num - The number of Tables that will be added into the array list tables.

    • findAvailTables

      public static ArrayList<Table> findAvailTables​(ArrayList<Table> t)
      Finds all the available Tables in the array list tables and input them into the array list t.
      Parameters:
      t - The array list containing all the available Tables in the restaurant.
      Returns:
      The array list t.

    • deleteRestTables

      public static void deleteRestTables​(int index)
      Deletes the Table with the specific index number from the array list tables.
      Parameters:
      index - The index number of the Table which will be removed from the array list.

    • getTableList

      public static ArrayList<Table> getTableList()

    • assignTable

      public static Table assignTable​(int pax)
      Assign a suitable available Table to a customer according to the number of people.
      Parameters:
      pax - The number of people.
      Returns:
      The index of the assigned Table.

    • unassignTable

      public static void unassignTable​(int tableNum)
      Unassign a Table which was previously assigned to a customer. Sets the availability status of the Table to available.
      Parameters:
      tableNum - The index number of the Table that is to be unassigned.
